pageSummaryWhat: In loving memory of Harbans Lloyd
pageSummaryWhy: of their compassionate care they give to families.
story:
On Thursday 8 October we very suddenly lost our beautiful Mum to a very aggressive cancer.  Words cannot even explain our grief and loss.

Mum was only 65 and had such an energy for life. She was a truly wonderful woman with a spirited soul. 

Over the past few days we have seen how she touched so many people's lives in so many ways.  She had so many friends and was loved by so many.  Her warm personality and smile were infectious - she really loved talking to people, she was genuinely interested in people's lives and always had time for everyone. 

She was loving, warm, kind, generous, loyal and had the biggest heart. Her family meant everything to her. She was a devoted wife, a supportive mother and dedicated grandmother and her legacy will live on in her four amazing grandchildren. 

Our hearts will never feel whole again without her but her love and energy for life will live on within us all always. 

We have set up this JustGiving page in her memory in support of Macmillan Cancer Care.  We were completely blown away by the amazing care and compassion that was shown to Mum and ourselves in her final days. The Macmillan Palliative Care team offered us support that we will never forget and this meant so much to us at such a difficult time in our lives.  

We kindly ask that instead of buying flowers for Mum's funeral that a donation be made instead to this amazing charity. We would like to do something positive during this very difficult time and as a family we would be grateful for any donations made. 

Thank you very much for all the kindness shown to us at this sad time.

Anthony, Caroline and Christina x

You will always be remembered by your family and friends as someone that we looked to in times of need, a man that was always there for us no matter what and a man that nothing was ever to much when you needed him.

You are at peace now and will be forever in and hearts and our minds.

XXX

Having announced last July that the PFM Partnership Awards 2020 presentation ceremony would be moved to 17 March 2021 to avoid issues arising from Covid-19-related developments, this year will see the Collaborative working and Covid-19 webinar discussion staged on 4 November.

It will discuss the various aspects of working in partnership between FMs and service providers to deal with the ongoing issues being experienced as a result of the virus and efforts to contain it. 

This event is free of attend but we are inviting guests to make a donation to our corporate charity Macmillan, to support the incredible work they do for people affected by cancer.

See where your money goes:

£14 funds the printing of 25 posters to promote a local Breast Cancer support group

£29 pays for a Macmillan nurse for 1 hour, helping people living with cancer and their families receive essential medical, practical and emotional support.

£52 helps run a large Macmillan Information & Support Centre for 1 hour.

£90 pays for a Macmillan Grant that buys fresh bedding for a person who is dealing with nausea, night sweats or incontinence because of their cancer treatment.

On 7th November 2020 I shall be attempting to cycle the hight of Mt Everest. 29029ft in one single ride. This is called Everesting. This should take me approximately 30 hours. Starting at 7am on 7/11/2020 and hopeful finish on 8/11/2020. I shall Be doing this in Trinidad and Tobago On a mountain called Morne La Croix. I shall be climbing the same climb approximately 22 times to achieve the hight necessary. I can not sleep but I can rest for short breaks to eat and hydrate during the entire challenge. 

I am attempting this challenge in honor of my farther Christopher Downes, who sadly passed away from cancer. I promised him I would do what I can to help the wonderful people from the Macmillan team that helped him when he needed help the most. 

Dad was a cycling enthusiast and I am sure would be proud if I can pull this one off and also be able to keep my promise of doing what I can for the Macmillan team . 

I look forward to hopefully being able to tell you I was able to complete this challenge. It’s going to be a rough one!!!!

pageSummary: I am going to be shaving my head
pageSummaryWhat: I am going to be shaving my head
story:
I shall be shaving my head in support of Cancer Research as I feel very strongly about the work this charity is carrying out worldwide. Cancer has had and continues to have a huge impact on mine and my families life. My mum is currently having Chemotherapy to fight a rare type of liver cancer and so it still plays a substantial part in our lives. My prayer is that one day cancer will be no more but we can only achieve this if we come together to fight it. 

I know I am not the only one going through this set of circumstances. Cancer will affect 1 in 2 of us during our lives so I'm doing this for all my friends and loved ones who have, are and will face this horrible disease. 

I somewhat care about my appearance and my hair is no exception so it will be an interesting experience! It could look quite bad!! (and more like my dad...)

Please sponsor me if you are able as I can't fight it alone. All money raised will go towards vital research so that in the future, families like mine will not have to experience being told the awful news of a loved one having cancer. 

Much love to you all and thank you for your support! xx

story:
Too many people are still drowning. More than ever we need the RNLI’s help. As a charity, the RNLI depends on our donations so it can go on saving lives and keeping us and our loved ones safe. RNLI lifesavers are our lifeline. They’re the lifeboat crews who provide 24-hour search and rescue right around the UK and Ireland. The lifeguards keeping watch on 240 of the busiest beaches in the UK and Channel Islands. And the RNLI safety teams and educators working tirelessly to stop people getting into trouble in the first place.Thank you.

Each Year Group has a different challenge as we are unable to mix our Year Group bubbles.  To keep up with our spirit of inter-house, we will be trying to see which House can raise the most money.

Year Three will be seeing how many times they can virtually
climb up the Spinnaker Tower which is 170m tall over the course of an hour.

Year Four will be trying to summit the equivalent height of
Ben Nevis (1345m) using the climbing frame within an hour.

Year Five will be seeing how many times they can climb the
equivalent of the Aztec temples in an hour, also using the climbing frame and avoiding the 'lava'.

Year Six will be walking the distance from Portsmouth to the
D Day landing beaches in France. They will all need to walk a minimum of 2.5 km, some of which whilst carrying a full rucksack.

Thank-you in advance for your donation, Hudson are really
appreciative of your support.

We’re the world’s leading independent conservation organisation. And we’re building a future where people and nature thrive together. 

That’s why we’re passionate about sharing the planet’s resources more sustainably, tackling climate change and protecting endangered wildlife.
charity.name: WWF-UK
story:
Here at Little Foxes Childcare, we are passionate about the world we live in and the animals we share it with.

We have always educated our foxes and ourselves on how we can protect and care for our world, however recently we watched David Attenboroughs 'Witness Statement' over on Netflix, this inspired us to do more to save our world.

Did you know?

- There are over 32,000 people in Hucknall, yet there are only just over 1000 Mountain Gorillas left in the WORLD!

- In Africa approximately every 26 minutes an Elephant is killed for its Ivory.

- Deforestation has become so bad that rainforests now cover less than 2% of the world, yet they are home to around 50% of all Earth's plants and animals.

Our planet needs help and instead of working against nature, we need to work with nature, together.

Little Foxes will be doing multiple fundraising events and ideas, we will also continue with our educational activities to teach our next generation to love our planet.

The WWF charity does amazing work to help our planet and in some areas, their dedication and work are already showing positive results.

We highly recommend watching David Attenborough's Witness Statement if you haven't already, this will show you the work they have done and what more we need to do to protect our planet and ultimately save future generations.

Let's do this, for our world,

Lots of love, 

Little Foxes
